website_summaries.verdict: Parents will enjoy its durability and ability to double as a little desk, while kids will love the colorful assortment of bundled building bricks.
pros: Wide surface allows multiple kids to play together
cons: Included building bricks are not official LEGO bricks

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We ordered and used it on our patio and put sand in it, it’s under cover so doesn’t get wet or anything! Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: FirstTimeMom

customer_reviews.title: So small and not functional!
customer_reviews.text: Way too small to be considered a lego "table"! This is so tiny and could be considered a small coffee table instead. My kindergarteners couldn't even sit at this with chairs--they had to kneel down. My biggest beef with this micro table is the storage space underneath. You cannot get to the legos without removing the top piece, which always spills your project all over the floor if it isn't 100% secured to the lego board. Awful! The drawer on a lego table needs to be pull out or easily accessible. This table is poorly designed and now I understand why another reviewer turned around the lid and just uses it as a coffee table. LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Letsgo4five

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this table. There was an issue with my order in which the tabletop did not fit the table base. KidKraft's customer service rep Scott responded quickly to my email and sent a replacement straight away. It took a couple of tries to figure out what was wrong with my table but Scott was on top of it and I am a happy customer because of his efforts. My sons love the table and it is the perfect size for them to play on their knees. They are 5 & 9 yrs old.
customer_reviews.author: rxdhdz

customer_reviews.title: Overall we like the table
customer_reviews.text: Does not work for LEGO brand, even the cheap “lego” blocks that comes with it does not stay on, some of it will pop out if you force it on. Overall we like the table, great storage space for my son LEGO we just need to remove the baseplate and replace it with the original LEGO brand.
customer_reviews.author: LaLaMom

customer_reviews.title: Mommy approved cuteness- kid approved fun!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for our kids for Easter! Arrived the day before but cracked! Had to return and wait almost a month for the new one (thanks to covid delays) BUT... once we got it the kids LOVE IT! It’s definitely cute and sturdy (even though it’s MDF) and just the right size for the 4&7 year old to play together in the floor with it! It’s cute enough that I even let it stay in the living room!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Vega

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with LEGO products.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was so excited to start building when I was done installing the table. As she started to create her train, we realized the baseplate didn’t fit the bricks provided easily. They either stick up on one side or don’t fit at all. The main reason I bought the table was for her LEGO set. However, the LEGO products does not fit well. Either it is too loose and comes off easily or it won’t fit on the baseplate at all. I love the table, color and storage, but had to buy LEGO brand baseplates and replace the ones that came with the table.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a great product for our small apt but the table is just to short and my 5 yr old has a terrible time trying to build on this table. It was easy to assemble but top doesn't fit quite right so you kinda have to force the top on when you want to flip the sides. After trying to use it a bunch of times with her legos my daughter has just gone back to playing with them on our coffee table. I think is table is just to short and the pegs on its lego side are just too large. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love the lego table, everything about it is perfect, it holds plenty of legos and is the perfect size. However, the materials it's made from are not sturdy. It broke when I was putting it together so I don't expect it to hold up being used by kids. If it was sturdier it would have been a five star. Also, I'm not sure why two of the people didn't come with legs... That's strange but not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Michell

customer_reviews.title: Great table, for the money. Keep expectations in check, this isn't a flawless table.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality table for the price. Not perfect (its surface clearly isn't the same quality as LEGO plastic) but its sturdy and the right size for my kids. There were some questionable quality issues as well with the wood laminate coating on an inside leg, but it doesn't show and is mostly irrelevant. Would buy it again, especially for the price. I've seen better tables like those they have at my son's school but they also cost 3 times the price.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely LOVE this table
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this table. I purchased it for my 4 year old who is a tough little boy and definitely gets the money worth out if any toy we buy him. So far this table has withstood him using it for any and everything. Including him standing on it to do his speeches. It was definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: An ExtraOrdinary Mom

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, durable, quick assembly. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this table for my great-grandsons, 7 and 3. It is more durable than I thought it would be. My grandson said it was a breeze to assemble. I played legos on it with the boys and it was great. Just the right size for the boys to play on it while sitting on the floor. The smooth reverse side is perfect for having their snacks on. Small enough to fit in corner, yet big enough to assemble 2 lego sets on at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Bev !!

customer_reviews.title: Cute but small!
customer_reviews.text: Cute table but very small. Much smaller than I expected. This is maybe for one child at a time, not more than that. Also -- this item came chipped, some of the surfaces were damaged. We've been using this LESS than ONE week and there are enough chips and spots of damage that it looks like its been used for years. Not happy with the quality of this table.
customer_reviews.author: EMPallmyLOVE

customer_reviews.title: Good table. Exactly what I needed for under my ...
customer_reviews.text: Good table. Exactly what I needed for under my son's loft bed. It was very easy to assemble (about 10 minutes). Gave it only 4 stars because it arrived damaged; otherwise, I'd give it 5. The table top had 2 significant chips on the flat surface side. May be an indication as to its durability especially with younger and multiple kids using it (my son is 10). Probably more trouble than it's worth to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Blast46

customer_reviews.title: Great little table, Lego plate glue adhesion issue though...
customer_reviews.text: This table is great for Legos (though as others have stated not all pieces stick, just be ready for that). We use the flat side most often anyway. I had hoped it would be big enough for the schleich play sets or calico critters but is a fairly small table. If you need a small, attractive table for your kids this is a good choice at a good price. My only complaint is after a year, with the Lego boards upside down they have pulled away from the table top and hang down. Someday I will try to re glued it. Just a little annoying.
customer_reviews.author: A. Piper

customer_reviews.title: Chinese...
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost, my boy loves this table. He doesn't really use the "lego" side since the pieces are Chinese crap and not Lego branded, they can be tough to put together, and the plates aren't pieced together correctly. The table is easy to put together and there is plenty of storage. The smooth side of the table is great. Would I purchase again knowing what I know? Absolutely not. I'd build one for him.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan S.

customer_reviews.title: Not LEGO compatible! Very low to the ground also.
customer_reviews.text: Very short so my 3 year old has to sit on the ground to use it. This was SUPER misleading. It is absolutely not LEGO compatible. I was having trouble shoving the pieces on and they’d pop off. The blocks provided didn’t fit well either. Those were even harder to use! I’m not taking this apart to send back so we’ll have to find another use or I’ll have to glue other plates over the ones there. Such a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Calligraphy Squad & Pen Squad

customer_reviews.title: Great little table, needs slightly better design.
customer_reviews.text: The table is the right size for my five-year-old. The bricks used work well with Lego's. The only issue is the storage. There is plenty of room for lots of Lego's, but there should be a drawer to access them. You have to remove the table top to get to the Lego's inside. If you've built something large, it's going to fall apart when you try to remove the table top.
customer_reviews.author: Channing Hayden III

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to assemble. Table is sturdy. Just the right height for floor play. Only complaint is that the removable top does drop down into the hole. It should lift in and out with ease for a child. I have to press hard to get it to work. Will try some sanding to see if it will fit better. Overall, I like the product and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Shopper

customer_reviews.title: one MAJOR flaw
customer_reviews.text: the lego board goes on top, the legos go under the top. What has to happen when your kid wants more legos? they have to remove the top. I know the drawer style costs more but the drawer would be so handy. our solution was to keep the legos in a old tupperware container so my children can just take the container of legos out.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Nall

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The product came cracked in the leg. Unfortunately got it too close to Christmas to return at that time. Was offered a refund if returned or a replacement product. I did not use this opportunity because I felt the product seemed not that durable to begin with and figured my rough boy would soon crack it anyway. Chose to fix it myself and make it more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie

customer_reviews.title: Really low quality
customer_reviews.text: The pre-drilled holes did not line up very well and the screws and lock nuts split or cracked and the threads do not line up the correct way and on one side the pre drilled hole was so close the the edge on the side that when I put the screw in it the wood split. It is a great concept bud a cheep design. Most regular Lego's do not click in or line up the correct way on the side that has the Lego studs on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice LEGO Table
customer_reviews.text: I bought this LEGO Table for a very low price used like new and I am very happy with my purchase. It is a good size for the price, sturdy and I can’t wait to give this to my child as a Christmas present this year. I have had a good experience with KidKraft brand products over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Q

customer_reviews.title: Good for Lego storage
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of stepping on Legos all day every day. My kids didn't have any set place to store them. This is a good option. My kids don't use the side with building brick surface because Legos don't fit on it very well (since this table isn't officially for Legos). But, it's still a good storage table and play table for them.
customer_reviews.author: David R Holtkamp

customer_reviews.title: Great lego table
customer_reviews.text: Kids like to sit on the floor and build Lego together and watch movies. Surprisingly sturdy and well made. So glad I purchased two while I had the chance! Very happy with both tables - I saved some money and bought Amazon Warehouse “Very Good” and “Like New” .... No issues. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not perfectly compatible with actual LEGO
customer_reviews.text: Basically well designed and easy to assemble. Only problem is that the LEGO surface is not LEGO but some generic substitute, it works ok to attach lego people or small bricks, but the flat bases of my kids’ larger LEGO kits will not attach. Which basically makes it a bumpy table. I’m going to try to find a way to replace the surface with actual LEGO plates.
customer_reviews.author: GillianS

customer_reviews.title: Space saving lego storage
customer_reviews.text: I only give this product a 4 star instead of a 5 because I recieved it with chips on the structure. I still put it together rather than send it back over that. Overall it is cute and small but big enough to store my childrens legos and not take up a big chunk of space
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Look at customer photos to see common defects.
customer_reviews.text: MAKE SURE YOU LOOK AT THE CUSTOMER PHOTOS!! There were a couple defects in the trim, and a chip missing from a corner of the table top, but nothing that will likely bother a 4yo. If I had seen it assembled in a store, I would've asked for a mark down, but still would've bought it. MAKE SURE YOU LOOK AT THE CUSTOMER PHOTOS!! These defects seen to be very common. Otherwise I like the table. The Lego bricks can snap across the seams between the 4 Lego boards on the table.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is.
customer_reviews.text: This table is smaller (height wise) I kew that from the previous reviews ok for my kids they can all kneel next to it. My issues with this table come from the assembly I had to struggle and pound the bottom to get it to fit into the groove to hold the lego pieces. Also it was bit of a struggle to get the top to fit down where it was supposed to. I think that because the bottom was hard to get in this led into the top also having a problem. Does it do what I wanted it to do? Yes. Was it a PITA to put together? Yes. Hence, the rating.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie M Bonello

customer_reviews.title: Great table to play legos on
customer_reviews.text: Great table to play legos on. Only thing I wished the under neath would pull out like a drawer. You have to lift off the top to get to the underneath compartment
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Pace

customer_reviews.title: Space saver and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Get it for my kids, they love build Lego, and this one is big enough for our home. The kids can reverse the table top to choose from the flat surface or the Lego building platform. Lot of the storage space for toy and Lego under the table. The only thing is the corner of the table top easily get peeled and damaged
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Does Not work well with LEGO brand
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work with LEGO brand very well. it can but its very difficult and not easy for children. It does come with a few generic blocks. can't reach lego in the table while building on the top unless you take the top off. it needs an accessible basket on the side.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, easy to put together!
customer_reviews.text: This is a versatile table and great spot to keep a younger childs legos and or toys. The storage space is not overly big so I say a younger child because when our kids were young, their lego collection outgrew the largest of containers. This is just a great table for toddlers!!
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: A big hit.
customer_reviews.text: Received this product yesterday. Was super-easy to put together (by myself) and my nephew was up and running within 20 minutes of me unboxing it. The quality is much better than I had expected, to be honest. My nephew is 5 1/2 and he is really into Legos. He can keep his completed projects out of the way by lifting up the top board and placing them into the compartment below (-which is not a drawer, btw). I can tell that he and his playdate buddies will really enjoy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Quality product and looks nice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for Christmas. He loves it! It’s great quality and looks nice! I like that the top is grey and not green (just visually my preference) it came with some legos and can hold a bunch more! The top sits in the table nice and snug so it won’t fly up if they lean on it.
customer_reviews.author: Laladm

customer_reviews.title: Good, easy clean-up fun!
customer_reviews.text: Love the simple design. No chairs needed. Kids can sitnin the floor and play. Doesnt. Take up too much space. Love the fact that you can flip the board around for them to play on besides just the lego board. And I love that it has the lego storagem sweet and easy pick up. Nothing to dislike about this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing sticks to the Lego side!
customer_reviews.text: It's a good little table, but one side of the surface is a Lego base... Not actual TM️Legos, so I'm not too shocked that Legos don't actually fit on it but it came with it's own knock-off Legos and THEY don't fit on the base!!!! So 3 stars because a major feature of the table is basically useless.
customer_reviews.author: Lightningboltgirl

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy it for over $50. It's not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I expect more for paying over $50. The table itself is not sturdy at all and the grooves/edges have chipped out. My husband have to use duck tape to prevent the bolt from turning. This table would be a good buy for at most $20 only.
customer_reviews.author: JonahLyn Gadingan

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I had higher hopes for this. The table itself it exactly as advertised. Works really well for toddlers/preschoolers and their toys. Storage is more than enough for quite a few Legos. Be careful around younger kids as their fingers can get caught between the table top and the sides by their older siblings. Con: Lego mat adhesive is about as strong as post-it notes, needs something much stronger Pros: Lightweight, easy to move around, stores toys easily. Works with Duplo and Lego blocks.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: Poor materials that don’t match up.
customer_reviews.text: The pieces don’t match up while assembling the first one was missing pieces the second never fit together right. It was a gift for a little boy and I was completely embarrassed that it was as poor as it was. Wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.author: Heather P

customer_reviews.title: Plenty Sturdy for Intended Use
customer_reviews.text: Summary - While I was hesitant to purchase due to it being made of cheap particle board, I would recommend purchasing due to good looks and reasonably sturdy construction. Not an heirloom piece but it's functional and gives those legos a nice home. Pros - -Sturdier than I expected. -My boys (5 and 7) love it and have no problem reversing the top. -Has not started to show wear nor has it become wobbly. Cons - -Made of particle board. -Legs attach with common threaded barrel type hardware.
customer_reviews.author: OTZR

customer_reviews.title: Really nice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to use when playing with her legos. She loves it. Now she can build a big lego city and leave it without worrying she's going to trip on it. It's very sturdy and a nice size. Lots of storage.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine  Ickes callahan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Fun Lego Table
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Lego table. It's very sturdy and has held up well so far with my active 3 year old. There is room to store all of the Legos we have accumulated and is a great way to keep everything together!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: cute- small
customer_reviews.text: Works great for one kid at a time. I just ordered a second one so each kid has their own "work station." Short to the ground, but works perfect for 5 and 7 year olds to sit and have their legs underneath
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Flowers

customer_reviews.title: it disrupts the lego pattern and blocks don't hold across the seams which defeats the purpose of having a nice large space to bu
customer_reviews.text: The table itself is decent quality but the surface is four small panels instead of one large. Where they meet, it disrupts the lego pattern and blocks don't hold across the seams which defeats the purpose of having a nice large space to build on.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory Fiordellisi

customer_reviews.title: cant connect leggos across the plates
customer_reviews.text: great table versatile but when u try and put legos across the plates u cant i might have to take the plates off an redo the plates with lego brand but other than that my kids loved it this morning for xmas
customer_reviews.author: Rinka

customer_reviews.title: Most Brand LEGOS don’t work WITH BOARD.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t really like how you have to moved the whole top to get legos. The opening is big enough for a lil hand but you can’t see what your grabbing unless you moved the whole top. And when you moved it to get a LEGO whatever you were building falls and gets destroy. Certain LEGOS DON’T FIT either making hard for them to stay.
customer_reviews.author: adrian

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Like the reviews said it is smaller. We don’t have a lot of extra room so we didn’t care. Our boy is 6 and he is tall and it is still a good height for her to sit and play with it just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice lego/craft table for kids
customer_reviews.text: I seen a lot of negative feedback on this so I was on the fence about getting it. Grandson loves it. Only downside is can’t keep legos inside the table when you are playing legos on the top of the table. So we just store them in bins under the table and put writing/coloring materials under the top.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald R Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Can’t build
customer_reviews.text: This package came as if it was opened. I still tried to build it and it looks as if it the person before me also had issues building as there were scratched on wood The pieces do not align.
customer_reviews.author: Grisel Aponte

customer_reviews.title: Perfect table!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect table for my 18-month old to play with her legos :) Really easy to build and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Linda J.

customer_reviews.title: Check the fit.
customer_reviews.text: Great little Lego table. Only one caveat, The gray peg board for building on does not fit real Legos, only the knock offs. Easy assembly. I replaced the gray pegboard sheets.
customer_reviews.author: YoAdrianne0

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with a simple modification
customer_reviews.text: Had to change out the boards that it comes with as they are not LEGO brand and they are very difficult to use with Legos. But that was ridiculously easy (Just peel the old ones off and glue the new ones on.) Worth the price, no doubt.
customer_reviews.author: bryan

customer_reviews.title: Particleboard issues and LEGOs won’t click in without trial and force
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble but one screw got stuck and it tore right through the particle board and remained projecting outward. The table top was really hard to insert and the LEGO panels were slightly misaligned. It was a struggle to “click” a single LEGO down without hurting adult(!) my fingers. Looked cute tho and seemed sturdy before assembling issue.
customer_reviews.author: KingofClowntopia

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, good storage
customer_reviews.text: So far this product is great. The kids haven't been too hard on it yet so durability remains to be seen. Good height for my littles (3 and 6). Will be able to use for years to come as long as it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria L Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: The only issue is the lid is one piece and storage capacity isn’t much, recommend they make the lid (table top) that can be open from one side with a hinge in the middle. Also built in sliding storage containers under the unit would add additional space. Other than that I am still happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as expected, but great for such a low price
customer_reviews.text: This table was not as sturdy as I had expected, but because we purchased it for our 9 year old and not our toddlers, it should work fine. No problems connecting LEGO brand blocks to the tabletop, other reviews had me expecting this problem. We love the storage space under the table top as well as under the table itself. For the price it was a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Maisie Fredericksen

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: Great for price. Assembly is not very easy but worth it for the price & end result. Looks great in my daughters' room. Perfect height for my 6 & 8 yr olds to sit on the floor and play with legos.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco /Jessica Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Normal Legos Will Be Tough To Use...
customer_reviews.text: Table is very sturdy and we love that the top can be flipped over and used to color, play, etc. Massive issue we have is with the Lego table base plates themselves. The "dots" are noticeably larger than standard Lego baseplates and prove to be difficult when pressing standard Legos into place. My 5 year old grows very frustrated knowing he will have to fight his giant container of normal Legos into the table's baseplates. First chance I will be replacing the Lego baseplates.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My Grandson loves this table. Very sturdy and he uses the inside as a sort of sandbox except with beans to play with his trucks. Top works for legos
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lou

customer_reviews.title: Great for the little ones!
customer_reviews.text: It’s not exactly comparable with the real Legos, but if you press hard enough, it works! Might have to help the little one out but it’s a great table. Steardy. Only thing was, for some reason I thought it had pull out drawers for the space underneath. You have to actually lift the top. We get a lot of use with it, so it’s a good buy! =)
customer_reviews.author: Leo Bwell

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy table
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised how well the pieces fit. The size is just right. It has quite a lot of storage space as well. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: A tight fit, assembly and compatibility.
customer_reviews.text: A cheaper alternative to our favorite interlocking brick system's tables, but I should have spent the extra money. The table is frustratingly sturdy: assembly was easy enough, opening the table to access the storage needs a bit of elbow grease. The two side divets allow bricks to constantly spill over the side and onto the floor. Overall, not impressed. I got what I paid for: not much, for not much.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Miller

customer_reviews.title: Reduces loose blocks that lie wait for you to step on them
customer_reviews.text: This organizes the Lego mess. It stores the Lego mess. It is much more enjoyable to play at a table than on the floor. Grandpa approved.
customer_reviews.author: Dave G.

customer_reviews.title: Lego brand pieces DO NOT fit
customer_reviews.text: This table is NOT compatible with LEGO brand legos. The circles on the table are larger than the LEGO pieces and therefore extremely hard to place the small LEGO pieces on and impossible to place the large pieces on. Will return ASAP. Super disappointing. My daughter was so excited for this.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy table
customer_reviews.text: This lego table is nice and sturdy. Works well with Legos. I like that you can flip the top over so the table can be used as a play table for other toys.
customer_reviews.author: KStar

customer_reviews.title: Poor design for young children. Broke immediately.
customer_reviews.text: Poor design for young children. My son broke it immediately in the first 1 minute of use. If you lift the lid from one side as a child would, the other side of the lid falls underneath the braces on which the lid normally rests. Now it's wedged open and a child's natural reaction is to pull down to close it. That broke the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Dugan

customer_reviews.title: Great Table
customer_reviews.text: So sturdy and cute! We had a large train table like this but it was just too bulky. This is perfect! It’s also very solid!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great concept, and somewhat well executed
customer_reviews.text: A great concept, and somewhat well executed. Feels a bit flimsy, especially when trying to push bricks into the middle section of the top, so I hope it holds up to the abuse that a young child can deliver. The faux-LEGO top seems to work well with real LEGOs, but the free knock-off LEGOs it came with were quite low quality. Not a big deal since I didn't buy the table for the free bricks.
customer_reviews.author: Carlin Fuerst

customer_reviews.title: Weird height
customer_reviews.text: My only gripe with this table is that it has a weird height. Not enough to fit a chair and have my son sit to play (4 yrs old), but not low enough to sit on the floor either. It's more of a stand and play table, which is a shame if you want it to double as a study area.
customer_reviews.author: Lizbeth Colon

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice lego table for the price. I love the storage underneath. It has held up to our kids rough play. It comes with some legos but they are not authentic so they do not necessarily work with regular legos.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Daughter likes it for her legos. has decent storage for all her legos and a lot of space for building on.
customer_reviews.author: thomas j johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice table, Legos don't fit well on table top
customer_reviews.text: This table is nice and sturdy. They storage space is great. The reversible top is perfect for my coloring obsessed girls. My only complaint is that Legos don't fit well on the table top provided. My girls don't seem to be bothered by it, though. They just build creations without attaching them to the table top.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle A Kale

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Everything was good, except one of the flat LEGO table pieces that was already glued down was misaligned.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Titus-Green

customer_reviews.title: Not the best option but works
customer_reviews.text: For $35 I can’t complain to much. It was easy to put together and makes a great storage for legos. However legos don’t stick to the base plates very good. Definitely couldn’t have found a better deal so will just modify it with other base plates.
customer_reviews.author: Freckle.Face.Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great product for us
customer_reviews.text: Brought this for my 5 year old for Christmas and he loved it. It is small but works great for what we need in his room. Wish it had a drawer to pull out so that you didn’t have to take the lid off every time to get legos but it’s not that big of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Not great craftmanship for the price
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this table specifically because it was supposed to work with Legos. Unfortunately, our Legos barely snap onto the table. We also had to take the table insert to a wood shop and shave off part of a side so that it would actually sit inside the table top. Overall, we were disappointed by its craftmanship based on its price.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Newman

customer_reviews.title: My 6 year old loves this table
customer_reviews.text: This was for my son’s 6th birthday. He loves this table and uses it daily for Legos among other random games he plays. I bought this knowing the height might be awkward but it works great for him. We don’t have chairs for it and he just kneels and sits by it and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha L. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Not satisfied with the durability of this. Table is not as strong as I would like. Did not hold up with pre-K CLASS.
customer_reviews.author: Kim West

customer_reviews.title: it is really small
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandkids who love their Legos. I was embarrassed about the size and the quality of the table. I ended up building one myself.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged and legos don’t fit
customer_reviews.text: The tabletop was damaged. The “wood” side is just laminate stuck on a board which chipped and is fraying. There are similar chips on the side and legs of the table. The damage on the legoboard side was minor and only in a tiny corner. The bigger problem was that there is a seam that runs down the middle so legos don’t fit along that line. I’m giving it one star but it really would be perfect if it weren’t damaged right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Regan

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: For how quickly it was to assemble the table I gave it 3 stars. I can't imagine this table will last very long, but if your child is anything like mine, this could just be a building phase. So there won't be so much of a loss if the phase does not last long.
customer_reviews.author: NoMora

customer_reviews.title: Very sad
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea of this the storage space is great its low so the kids can sit on the floor and play but when it came in the top board is all worped so the Lego pieces just pop right off and we have only had it for a week and it's already falling apart could be great if u go to home depot and buy your own top board
customer_reviews.author: Sam V.

customer_reviews.title: This fell apart and pp
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a great addition to Lego playtime. After a few days the screws holding the legs on loosened. 2 of the holes were stripped another one ended up splitting to the side piece. The final problem was that it wasn't truly Lego compatible. The Legos held well in some spots but in other places not even an adult could get it to set in place.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Libby

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid table, but the top could be sturdier.
customer_reviews.text: The kids love this table, which I’ve only had one week. My biggest concern is that a child will try to stand on the top and break it. I’m considering reinforcing the top piece. (Hence only 3 stars for sturdiness and durability.) Other than the top being somewhat vulnerable to breaking, the table seems quite solid. The assembly instructions were thorough and easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: VFiT

customer_reviews.title: Very good, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Just what we wanted for our little guy. Super easy to put together, well packaged, good size. Thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: ZRreviews

customer_reviews.title: Great amount for storage and table top play.
customer_reviews.text: The reversible table top makes it great for building buildings on top to playing with non lego toys.
customer_reviews.author: C.H.B.

customer_reviews.title: The table is nice. The blocks and plates to build on do ...
customer_reviews.text: The table itself is nice. The blocks provided and plates to build on do not connect well. They go together hard, and come apart easily. Lego brand blocks do not connect to it well either. I will have to buy Lego brand plates to make this work with all his other Lego's. That will cost as much as this table did. I would not buy this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift for my grandson. Helped to organize little parts to his wooden train tracks.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very easy assembly. Comes with some Legos also which I didn't know. My 1 1/2 and 4 year old love it
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Westerberg

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: Product is not good quality at all, which is odd because KidKraft is supposed to be a quality brand. Pieces came broken and further fell apart while putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Top doesn't fit. It's too big.
customer_reviews.text: I put the table together pretty easily, it seemed to be decent quality. The top piece it about an 1/8 of an inch too wide and does not fit on top.
customer_reviews.author: lilauralou

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: My kids love it. They can't get enough of legos. And the storage space is more than enough. Definitely worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Such a great product
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect. Sturdy... easy to put together and exactly as pictured. My 5 yr old and 2 yr old love it. Great price. Can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Magill

customer_reviews.title: Great table for autistic child
customer_reviews.text: Really like this table, a great sensory table for an autistic child. Great storage for sensory items. I placed it in my great room.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: Very quick to assemble. nice storage area and sturdy! Lego brand will not connect to the brick side, but not an issue for us.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Count

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: My nephew just turned 3 and is obsessed with LEGO’s at the moment. He loved this table! It’s a non-traditional LEGO table and looks great in any room. The LEGO pieces fit fine if you use a little strength to push them down. Great storage as well! Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie O.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Way smaller than I thought it would be. Not for 5 year old
customer_reviews.author: Dange

customer_reviews.title: Birthday gift
customer_reviews.text: Birthday gift for my nephew, he did not use for legos, but for his nerf gun stuff
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: got this for our grandson for Christmas. He immediately started playing with and left all his other gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Cheap glue board. Came apart fell on my son. Now he walks with a lisp.
customer_reviews.author: Kscott

product_meta.title: KidKraft 2-in-1 Activity Table with Board, Gray/Natural
product_meta.description: Our Activity Play Table is sturdy and strong, giving young kids a perfect spot for letting their imaginations run wild. 200 LEGO compatible blocks are included, so the good times can start right away. The Activity Table is large enough for multiple children to play at once and features a convenient storage space under the play board. Parents will love how the play table keeps bedrooms more organized and moves the action closer to eye level. Table measures 25 x 23 x 16 inches. Ages 3 and up.
feature_bullets: Available in a variety of colors
Material Type: Mdf T molding melamine

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars943 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
